kickstart.articles

Class Composite

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.salespointframework.core.AbstractEntity<org.salespointframework.catalog.ProductIdentifier>
      • org.salespointframework.catalog.Product
        • kickstart.articles.Article
          • kickstart.articles.Composite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<org.salespointframework.catalog.Product>, org.springframework.data.domain.Persistable<org.salespointframework.catalog.ProductIdentifier>

    @Entity
public class Composite
extends Article
    This class represents the furniture that is made of many Part. In our example that would be a table made of 4 chair legs and 1 table top. See the composite pattern for information about the design.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Composite

        public Composite()
        Empty constructor for data base interactions. Shouldn't used otherwise.

      • Composite

        public Composite(@NotNull
                 @NotNull java.lang.String name,
                 @NotNull
                 @NotNull java.lang.String description,
                 @NotNull
                 @NotNull java.util.List<Article> parts)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Standard constructor for Composite. See Article for more information as it's the base class
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the article
        description - the description of the article
        parts - A list of Article that this composite consists of.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the size of parts is zero.

    • Method Detail

      • addPart

        public void addPart(@NotNull
                    @NotNull Article article)
        Adds a new part to the list of parts.
        Specified by:
        addPart in class Article
        Parameters:
        article - The new part to get added to parts

      • removePart

        public void removePart(@NotNull
                       @NotNull Article article)
        Removes one appearance of a part if the part is present. If the part isn't present, nothing happens. The method ensures that the number of parts is always greater than zero. If this operation would lead to an empty list, the article won't get removed.
        Specified by:
        removePart in class Article
        Parameters:
        article - The article that should get removed.

      • getParts

        public java.util.List<Article> getParts()
        Returns:
        All parts this article consists of. Since they don't get saved in the database, this list might be empty

      • getPartIds

        public java.util.Map<org.salespointframework.catalog.ProductIdentifier,java.lang.Integer> getPartIds()
        Specified by:
        getPartIds in class Article
        Returns:
        Returns a list of the ids for every part

      • update

        public boolean update(@NotNull
                      @NotNull java.util.List<Article> parts)
        Description copied from class: Article
        Updates the article after changes in this article or in it's parts
        Specified by:
        update in class Article
        Parameters:
        parts - The list of all parts obtained from the catalog, since they aren't saved in the article. Use the method getPartIds to get the information which articles to get from the catalog
        Returns:
        Returns true if the attributes got updated. Returns false if a part needs to get updated before

      • getWeight

        public org.salespointframework.quantity.Quantity getWeight()
        Specified by:
        getWeight in class Article
        Returns:
        Returns the weight of this composite. The weight is received by adding the weights of the parts.

      • getPrice

        Overrides:
